abstract: The investment arms of large Taiwanese and Chinese manufacturers have created an investment network in Silicon Valley that pumps money into a variety of chip, software and services companies, and some have proven more willing than entrenched U.S. venture capitalists to back risky endeavors.
snippet: The investment arms of large Taiwanese and Chinese manufacturers have created an investment network in Silicon Valley that pumps money into a variety of chip, software and services companies, and some have proven more willing than entrenched U.S. ...
lead_paragraph: For years, the process remained relatively static: PC makers like Hewlett-Packard and Apple, with well-staffed research labs and design departments, would dream up their next product and then hire a Chinese or Taiwanese fabricator to manufacture the largest number of units at the lowest possible cost.

headline.main: Asia Gains Edge Backing Tech Start-Ups
